channel.title: Need easy help! please quick
channel.description:
Can someone just tell me EXACTLY where this line of code should go? In which file and what under? Don't worry about the #'s I'll take care of that. Thanks!!
[code] public static int LSMini[] = {#, #, #};[/code]

item.title: Need easy help! please quick
item.dc:creator: @_bool
item.description:
@_bool wrote:

addItem requires a single integer as an argument so you need to select a random index from the array to use as a value.

Read full topic

item.title: Need easy help! please quick
item.dc:creator: @4markie 4markie
item.description:
@4markie wrote:

well I put this in there, isn’t that what it’s trying to access? It’s there but it acts as if not…

    public static int lsmini[] = {1, 1, 1};

Read full topic

item.title: Need easy help! please quick
item.dc:creator: @_bool
item.description:
@_bool wrote:

It tells you what the issue is, it can’t find the variables you are trying to access. You need to declare them.

Read full topic

item.title: Need easy help! please quick
item.dc:creator: @4markie 4markie
item.description:
@4markie wrote:

I get this error:

client.java:4210: cannot find symbol symbol : variable useItemID location: class client if (useItemID == 989 && atObjectID == 10624) { ^ client.java:4210: cannot find symbol symbol : variable atObjectID location: class client if (useItemID == 989 && atObjectID == 10624) { ^ client.java:4211: cannot find symbol symbol : method lsmini() location: class client addItem(lsmini(), 1); ^ Note: stream.java uses or overrides a deprecated API. Note: Recompile with -Xlint:deprecation for details. 3 errors Files Compiled Successfully! Press any key to continue . . .

Read full topic

item.title: Need easy help! please quick
item.dc:creator: @_bool
item.description:
@_bool wrote:

inside the global scope but outside the local scope of a method.

[code]public class AnExampleClass {
// This is in the global scope.
public static int LSMini[] = {#, #, #}; // public modifier allows it to be accessed by any class. static modifier means it stays the same throughout all instances of this class and can be accessed statically, like AnExampleClass.LSMini as a pose to anExampleClassInstance.LSMini if it wasn’t static.

public void anExampleMethod {
// this is the local scope of this method.
int crap = 3; // its only accessible by code in this methods scope.
}
}[/code]

Read full topic

item.title: Need easy help! please quick
item.dc:creator: @chassy13 Chassy13
item.description:
@chassy13 wrote:

Anywhere outside of another method. Most likely in client.java. Don’t declare it inside another piece of code.

Example:

[code]public void hey() {
//stuff
}

public static int LSMini[] = {#, #, #};

public void bye() {
//stuff
}[/code]

Didn’t bother using conventions as that was just an example.

Read full topic
